intro: Vincentella densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered vincentella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Vincentella densiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
